FuncDef:
The adaptive-routing bandwidth command configures the upper and lower thresholds for the bandwidth utilization level in a dragonfly profile.
The undo adaptive-routing bandwidth command restores the default upper and lower thresholds for the bandwidth utilization level in a dragonfly profile. The adaptive-routing bandwidth command configures the upper and lower thresholds for the bandwidth utilization level in a dragonfly profile. The undo adaptive-routing bandwidth command restores the default upper and lower thresholds for the bandwidth utilization level in a dragonfly profile. By default, the upper threshold is 6 and the lower threshold is 3. This command is supported only on the CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the lower threshold for the bandwidth utilization level.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 7. The default value is 3. high-threshold-value must be greater than low-threshold-value.

Specifies the upper threshold for the bandwidth utilization level.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 7. The default value is 6. high-threshold-value must be greater than low-threshold-value.
